issue.title: lancasterarchery.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

ublock origin 1.58.1b2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed analytics or tracker

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://lancasterarchery.com/products/kisik-lee-inside-the-archer-book-3rd-edition?af_lnk=KAMINSKI&dt_id=654484%3Bap%3A348327&utm_medium=tier_one&utm_source=collab 

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

_No response_

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

Link was found by following https://collabs.shop/e35a2d with af_lnk and dt_id not removed; first is an affiliate link and second doesn't impact page noticeably by removing so likely also tracking. Tested with only adguard url tracking filter, ublock origin defaults + adguard url tracking filter, and all nonregional filters in ublock origin with same results.

Suggested fix would be editing https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/TrackParamFilter/sections/specific.txt (I assume is used to build other list variations and combinations) to include
||lancasterarchery.com^$removeparam=af_lnk
and possibly
||lancasterarchery.com^$removeparam=dt_id
I do not know if there would be relevant fallout from handling it more generically for other sites too so these rules have the specific site in them.

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body:
I think that this one:
```adblock
||collect.stepstone.co.uk^
```
can be added to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/tracking_servers_firstparty.txt
And these:
```adblock
||totaljobs.com/analytics/api/v1/tracking
/^https:\/\/www\.totaljobs\.com\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+/$script,xmlhttprequest,domain=totaljobs.com
```
to - https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/SpywareFilter/sections/specific.txt

> App banner: `article[data-testid="hp-app-banner-holder"]` Possible analytics: `https://www.totaljobs.com/analytics/api/v1/tracking`, `collect.stepstone.co.uk` and `/^https:\/\/www\.totaljobs\.com\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+/`

Couldn't find the relevant information, is there a special place for rules related to analytics?

> I'm not sure if we should block the google play button?

It's in the footer (not annoying), so in my opinion it's not necessary to block it.
I'm not sure if we should block the google play button?
I don't see `xmlhttprequest` which is matched by this rule, but if it's necessary on your end then fine.

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/pull/180806#issuecomment-2149212094

It seems that `$xmlhttprequest` modifier also needs to be added.

Regarding the last rule, I mean this:
```adblock
/^https:\/\/www\.totaljobs\.com\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+/
```
Maybe it could be specified to `script` only and with `domain` modifier?
Like:
```adblock
/^https:\/\/www\.totaljobs\.com\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+\/[a-zA-Z0-9]+/$script,domain=totaljobs.com
```
